quoteFirst: _Experiment No. 10._--A mouse-colored rabbit weighing 1,927.8 grams was fed February 18, 1906, at
quoteLast: , with a concentrated aqueous extract of 250 grams of fresh _Astragalus mollissimus_ collected in September, 1905, and preserved in chloroform water. The temperature of this rabbit was 102.6°F. The fluid given was 40 c.c. At 2.45 p.m. the rabbit urinated and at 2.57 p.m. was dull and the respiration became rapid.
title: Barium: A Cause of the Loco-Weed Disease
author: Crawford, Albert C. (Albert Cornelius), 1869-1921

quoteFirst: May well be called this month the “Ruler of the Night.” From twilight till near the dawn his broad face looks condescendingly upon our little world, and by his example cheerily bids us “pursue the even tenor of our way.” Jupiter rises on the 1st at
quoteLast: , sets next morning at 4:02 a. m.; on the 16th, rises at 1:24 p. m., sets on 17th at 3:02 a. m.; rises on 30th, at 12:29 p. m., and sets next morning at 2:07 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, April 1885
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
